attributes.description: Specifies the type of fuel that the system processes and manages for aviation engines.
attributes.name: fuelType

attributes.description: Indicates the storage capacity of the fuel tank system under standard aviation conditions.
attributes.name: tankCapacity

attributes.description: Defines the operational pressure for fuel pumps to ensure a steady and consistent fuel supply.
attributes.name: pumpPressure

attributes.description: Specifies the level of system redundancy to ensure reliable operation under component failure scenarios.
attributes.name: redundancyLevel

attributes.description: Describes the efficiency of the fuel filtration system in maintaining high purity levels.
attributes.name: filterEfficiency

designScenario.description: The Fuel System is an advanced aeronautical subsystem engineered to manage the storage, regulation, and distribution of aviation fuel to aircraft engines. It ensures reliable operations under varying temperatures, pressures, and altitudinal changes, following stringent safety and efficiency standards.
designScenario.name: Fuel System

details.description: The system must accurately regulate fuel delivery to meet engines' operational phases, including power adjustments and emergencies.
The fuel pump should operate within defined pressure limits across all operational altitudes and temperatures.
Equipped with automatic shut-off, leak detection, and insulation to address hazardous situations.
Ensures that maintenance is feasible, system diagnostics are comprehensive, and the system adheres to reliability standards.

relationships.description: The Fuel Pump relies on the Fuel Tank to provide a consistent flow of fuel.
Flow Control Systems integrate with Pumps to efficiently distribute the fuel.
Distribution Valves are managed by the Control Unit for precise routing of fuel.

systemComponents.description: Houses aviation fuel safely and maintains temperature and pressure stability.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Tank

subComponents.description: Internal coating ensuring tank integrity and fuel safety.
subComponents.name: Tank Coating

subComponents.description: Sensors for monitoring internal temperature and pressure.
subComponents.name: Tank Sensors

systemComponents.description: Transports fuel at the required pressure from the tank to the distribution system.
systemComponents.name: Fuel Pump

subComponents.description: Controls pressure output to suit engine requirements.
subComponents.name: Pressure Regulator

systemComponents.description: Manages the flow and regulation of fuel, ensuring appropriate delivery to the engines.
systemComponents.name: Flow Control System

subComponents.description: Logic circuits for real-time flow adjustments.
subComponents.name: Flow Monitoring Circuit

subComponents.description: Interface for manual operation in case of automation failure.
subComponents.name: Manual Control Interface

systemComponents.description: Filters aviation fuel to remove impurities before delivery to engines.
systemComponents.name: Filtration Unit

systemComponents.description: Allows control over fuel routing to different engine feeds and reserves.
systemComponents.name: Distribution Valves

subComponents.description: Switches between active and reserve lines based on control inputs.
subComponents.name: Flow Switch Valve

comments.body: Key documentation of system operations and design choices.

constraintBlocks.expression: pressure >= 2 and pressure <= 5 and flowRate >= 50 and flowRate <= 100
constraintBlocks.name: OperationalConstraints

rag_context: The Fuel Delivery System is designed to precisely regulate and distribute de-icing fluid to critical aerodynamic surfaces. It operates within an operational pressure range of 2-5 bar and has a flow rate of 50-100 L/min. The pump and valve assembly are made of corrosion-resistant alloys to ensure high corrosion resistance. The system enforces dual pump circuits for redundancy, ensuring continuous operation. Additionally, the system is certified as per FAA and EASA requirements for de-icing safety.
